title: Lusatian Highlands
text:
The Lusatian Highlands or Lusatian Hills (, ; ; <a href="Upper%20Sorbian%20language">Upper Sorbian</a>: "Łužiske hory") form a <a href="hill">hill</a>y region in <a href="Germany">Germany</a> and the <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a>. A western extension of the <a href="Sudetes">Sudetes</a> range, it is located on the border of the German state of <a href="Saxony">Saxony</a> with the Czech <a href="Bohemia">Bohemia</a>n region. It is one of the eight natural landscapes of <a href="Upper%20Lusatia">Upper Lusatia</a>.
The Lusatian Highlands are named after the historic region of <a href="Upper%20Lusatia">Upper Lusatia</a>, while the southern Czech portion is also known as the <a href="%C5%A0luknov%20Hook">Šluknov Hook</a>. The hills are situated between the <a href="Elbe%20Sandstone%20Mountains">Elbe Sandstone Mountains</a> to the west and the somewhat higher <a href="Lusatian%20Mountains">Lusatian Mountains</a> and the <a href="Zittau%20Mountains">Zittau Mountains</a> to the east. The source of the river <a href="Spree%20%28river%29">Spree</a>, which runs through central <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a>, is located near the small town of <a href="Ebersbach%2C%20G%C3%B6rlitz">Ebersbach</a>.
The Lusatian Highlands are a famous tourist region that is portrayed in several movies. They are known for the beauty of the landscape and their picturesque towns with <a href="Baroque%20architecture">Baroque</a> churches and wooden houses. Popular tourist towns in the region are <a href="Schirgiswalde">Schirgiswalde</a>, also known as the capital of <a href="carnival">carnival</a> in Upper Lusatia, <a href="%C5%A0luknov">Šluknov</a> with its famous <a href="arboretum">arboretum</a>, and <a href="Rumburk">Rumburk</a> with medieval old town centre. Other notable towns include <a href="Ebersbach%2C%20G%C3%B6rlitz">Ebersbach</a>, <a href="Velk%C3%BD%20%C5%A0enov">Velký Šenov</a>, <a href="Neukirch/Lausitz">Neukirch/Lausitz</a>, <a href="Sohland%20an%20der%20Spree">Sohland an der Spree</a> and <a href="Kirschau">Kirschau</a>.
